intro: Limnorchis behringiana, commonly known as the Beringian water lily, is a rare aquatic plant native to the northern regions of North America and Asia. It is characterized by its broad, floating leaves that form a dense canopy on the water surface. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in the early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and beetles. Its roots are submerged, anchoring it to the lake or pond bottom while absorbing nutrients from the water. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive indicator of water quality and ecosystem health.
